title: Album Page, "Lion in Wood, Il Bargello Museum, Florence", November 13, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Paper-maker's label (located at lower right corner of sheet, oriented perpendicular to drawing): embossed in support at upper left corner of sheet: an oval with "J M P" in center, ornament above and a small banner that reads "BRISTOL" below.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner (perpendicular to drawing: (inscribed in circle) 86 / 99. Above drawing of lion seen in profile: (the hair is much more wavy). Below drawing of lion seen in profile: Lion in Wood / Il Bargello Museum -  / Florence - (copied from George Newtons [sic] drawing/ of the same) / November 13th 1887 / scale = 1/10 execution.
description: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  Depicted is a leaping lion clutching an orb with a fleur-de-lys.  The lion is seen from the front and also in profile.  Both sketches have very faint guide lines inscribed to assist with transfering the drawing to the sheet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Lion in Wood, Il Bargello Museum, Florence", November 13, 1887.
November 13, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-156.
